message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CC

This paper proposes a neural approach for automatic decipherment of lost languages, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper utilizes an expressive sequence-to-sequence model, which falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The model design is informed by patterns in language change documented in historical linguistics, which also involves machine learning techniques and falls under the category of cs.LG (Learning). The paper also innovates the training procedure by formalizing it as a minimum-cost flow problem, which falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper involves computational complexity analysis, which falls under the category of cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
